definition: to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey

sentences.english: He muckraked his political rivals with great relish.
sentences.chinese: 他兴致勃勃地揭发政敌的贪污腐化。

sentences.english: A lot of people start gardens and give up when the going gets tough.
sentences.chinese: 很多人兴致勃勃地开始种菜，但出现困难后就放弃了。

sentences.english: Employees in high spirits, and actively enthusiastic, each one not to be outdone.
sentences.chinese: 员工们兴致勃勃，积极踊跃，每一个都不甘示弱。

sentences.english: People jubilantly took part in the festival celebrations in the parks.
sentences.chinese: 人们兴致勃勃地参加游园活动。

sentences.english: He invited the woodcutter aboard the boat. He happily played the guqin for him.
sentences.chinese: 他立即请樵夫上船，兴致勃勃地为他演奏。

sentences.english: There were three professors at the railway station.They were deep in conversation.
sentences.chinese: 三位教授在火车站一边等车，一边兴致勃勃地聊着。

sentences.english: On one occasion, I and good friend Zhang Xinyi are happily playing a small wooden boat.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，我和好朋友张心怡正兴致勃勃地玩着小木船。

sentences.english: Scholes even in high spirits and a lot of children Bishi.
sentences.chinese: 斯科尔斯甚至还兴致勃勃地和孩子们比试了一番。

sentences.english: He was enthusing about his new computer.
I find that I go up it when I am light-footed and earnest.
sentences.chinese: 我发现上山的时候兴致勃勃步履轻健。

sentences.english: If you regulate the system, many people will be interested in buying.
sentences.chinese: 如果你调整了这个系统，将会有许多兴致勃勃的买家。
乔兴致勃勃地接待了他。

sentences.english: President Mr. YE Xuanping is enjoying the painting from Mr. GUAN Wei.
sentences.chinese: 会长叶选平在兴致勃勃地欣赏关伟的作品。
我正兴致勃勃的看足球。

sentences.english: At the beginning we still make the unboiled water that get wind, in spirits.
sentences.chinese: 一开始我们还做得风生水起，兴致勃勃。

sentences.english: Huo mulberry but full of beans, finish eating breakfast alone a person to go to Zao City.
sentences.chinese: 霍桑却兴致勃勃，吃完早餐独自一个人去枣市。

definition: happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
with keen interest (idiom)/with great pleasure/with gusto/eagerly
variant of 興高采烈|兴高采烈[xing4 gao1 cai3 lie4]
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
impatient (idiom); in a hurry/itching to get on with it
